item.title: Branches from three trees on the corner are over hanging into the carriageway causing vehicles to travel in the centre of the road. Also, there is debris in the gutter which is obscuring the kerb on the corner., 24th January

item.title: Many potholes all over the road (see pictures), 24th January
item.description:
Located at the end of Stanwick Drive where the roadway goes into 2ways. The potholes are located outside number 59.and in various other places. The lady who lives at 59, is in her mid 90,s and has no option but to cross the road at this junction. Quite dangerous for pedestrians or cyclists

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Stanwick Drive, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement sinking due to water running down from hill, 24th January
item.description:
On the road outside The Lodge on Leckhampton Hill. The run-off channels on Hartley Lane opposite have not been properly maintained, causing water from the hill to pool on the road and on the pavement at the top of the driveway. This area of pavement was dug up and re-laid some years ago as part of works by Severn Trent, however the issue has caused the pavement to become gradually lower and lower to the point that the underside of a car will now catch on entering/exiting the driveway of the property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole under trees, 24th January
item.description:
Please stop patching this section of road. It is back to how it was within a month. It needs a proper resurface. It is riddled with a 100 yard long stretch of potholes and crumbling road. I have managed to break my suspension using this bit of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Folly Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unrepaired damage, 24th January
item.description:
The pathway was a mess for a while with growth from roots of nearby trees so worksmen came to repair it. They didn't finish the job and just left it with barriers and signs around. Over the last few months people have been fed up so have pushed it over to be able to get their prams through. I live opposite and have assumed someone was coming back to finish the job. They haven't so I'm now reporting it as it's not only unsightly but could cause injury to someone walking past in the dark. It's exactly by the lemon chicane on Lobleys Drive. Fixing it at your earliest convenience would be most appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beamont Walk, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
